03b3867,linus@a161b567-7d1e-0410-9ef9-912c70fedb3f,2011-10-30 16:57:29 +0000,Reverted the change done in 19769 for issue 5990. Michiels fix in 19770 solves the problem in another way.
a5f7dd5,mvw@a161b567-7d1e-0410-9ef9-912c70fedb3f,2011-10-30 14:46:53 +0000,Fix for the part of issue 5990 that is a bug. The part of issue 5990 that is a feature request is not fixed by this commit. This change is to maintain a private attribute on the FigMessage to remember what kind of message is represented. This way, we do not need to query the model for this information, which is impossible during deletion of modelelements. The use of an array of booleans is admittedly ugly, but I was looking for a quick and reliable solution. I presumed that the Message never changes type.

f9df13e,mvw@a161b567-7d1e-0410-9ef9-912c70fedb3f,2010-06-21 12:11:02 +0000,Fix for issue 4282: Statemachine should not be owned by a class. Creating a statechart diagram or a activity diagram now correctly puts the statemachine or activitygraph in the namespace that owns the context. This implements WFR 2 of a class for when ArgoUML has to decide on a location for a statemachine. Added more tests to test the implemented code. This fix includes changes to the MDR subsystem - the equivalent EUML operations are not yet implemented at all. TODO: Not all cases are covered - such as operations on imported classes.
c9a2d5e,mvw@a161b567-7d1e-0410-9ef9-912c70fedb3f,2010-06-21 11:57:41 +0000,Fix for issue 4282: Statemachine should not be owned by a class. Creating a statechart diagram or a activity diagram now correctly puts the statemachine or activitygraph in the namespace that owns the context. This implements WFR 2 of a class for when ArgoUML has to decide on a location for a statemachine. Added more tests to test the implemented code. This fix includes changes to the MDR subsystem - the equivalent EUML operations are not yet implemented at all. TODO: Not all cases are covered - such as operations on imported classes.

2ade979,dthompson@a161b567-7d1e-0410-9ef9-912c70fedb3f,2009-01-14 20:33:14 +0000,Issue 1048: merging from branches/work_issue_1048_dthompson to trunk, implementing adjustment of labels on path items. Notable changes: * New mode at the top of the GEF mode stack: ModeLabelDrag, to handle the label drag events. The stack is reinitialised in MultiEditorPane.java. * Switched most (all?) of the path item placement strategies to PathItemPlacement * Selection boxes are removed for path items, and instead are highlighted in an alpha shaded blue. * Double-clicking anywhere in the shaded area of a path item edits the first editable text box. * Path item positions are saved to the .uml file using a modified PGML.tee. * Path item positions are restored from the .uml file using PrivateHandler.java. * Some tweaks to PathItemPlacement to make it position labels more reliably. For more info, see issue 1048 and http://argouml.tigris.org/wiki/Issue1048

5b9ccf3,mvw@a161b567-7d1e-0410-9ef9-912c70fedb3f,2008-12-18 19:59:41 +0000,Aligned Fig size: before, different parts of a class had width 60, but name and stereo were 90. You could see this give a special effect when drawing classes in certain cases. In ArgoUML V0.22 the old value of 60 was changed to 90, IIRC not intentionally. Hence, I wanted to restore the value to 60 now, but to align to grid better, it would better be a multiple of 16 (or 8). So, the final choice is 64.

b696192,thn@a161b567-7d1e-0410-9ef9-912c70fedb3f,2006-11-15 10:36:55 +0000,not a fix, but in context of issue 4495: change of import behavior: instead of exceptions when some classifier is not found, now it is dynamically generated in the model. The only issue is, that when it's not clear if it's a class or interface, then a class is generated. If this guess is wrong, then this could lead to a realization of a class, which is strange, but this seems to be no problem for the model (I tested this). Another remark: this feature is only enabled for full import, and only for the second import run.

194fcdc,bobtarling@a161b567-7d1e-0410-9ef9-912c70fedb3f,2006-10-07 18:00:25 +0000,Override instead of extend propertyChangeEvent. The default behaviour of GEF is to propogate the event up through the Fig groups to the top level parent. This results in Figs recieving events that we do not expect. This change should result in less (hopefully no) warnings of unexpected events.

Getters and remove methods are wrapped because they may encounter deleted model elements as a transient condition when used in an unsynchronized fashion, but setters are not on the assumption that any errors there are fatal and should not be caught by the caller.

CVS: Obtained from: CVS:   If this change has been taken from another system, CVS:   then name the system in this line, otherwise delete it. CVS: Submitted by: CVS:   If this code has been contributed to the project by someone else; i.e., CVS:   they sent us a patch or a set of diffs, then include their name/email CVS:   address here. 4626485,mvw@a161b567-7d1e-0410-9ef9-912c70fedb3f,2005-08-13 10:28:24 +0000,More from http://argouml-stats.tigris.org/nonav/reports/findbugs/: Questionable use of non-short-circuit logic THis code seems to be using non-short-circuit logic (e.g., &amp; or |) rather than short-circuit logic (&amp;&amp; or ||). Non-short-circuit logic causes both sides of the expression to be evaluated even when the result can be inferred from knowing the left-hand side. This can be less efficient and can result in errors if the left-hand side guards cases when evaluating the right-hand side can generate an error.
77430c1,mvw@a161b567-7d1e-0410-9ef9-912c70fedb3f,2005-08-13 09:48:47 +0000,More from http://argouml-stats.tigris.org/nonav/reports/findbugs/: Creating new instances of java.lang.Boolean wastes memory, since Boolean objects are immutable and there are only two useful values of this type. Use the Boolean.valueOf() method to create Boolean objects instead.
32ccf6a,mvw@a161b567-7d1e-0410-9ef9-912c70fedb3f,2005-08-13 09:41:29 +0000,Some style issues.

(Only) at creation time of the package fig, the setting in the menu Edit->Settings->Notations->Show visibility is followed. After this moment, the user may toggle visibility per Fig in a popup menu, and with the aid of a checkbox on the Presentation panel. The user choice is stored together with the Fig persistently (i.e. saved with the project).

1033da3,bobtarling@a161b567-7d1e-0410-9ef9-912c70fedb3f,2005-05-12 21:12:14 +0000,Make bounds setting more efficient. It is more efficient to calls setBounds than to call both setSize() and setLocation(). It is more efficient to call setSize() than to call setWidth() and setHeight(). Not just that this is another method call be the fig is actually moved/resized for each bounds element if called individually rather than just once by setBounds(). This is compounded if a Fig contains child figs as the extra work is multiplied by all children that are also resized/moved.

0b8b3ec,mvw@a161b567-7d1e-0410-9ef9-912c70fedb3f,2004-08-01 08:24:28 +0000,From Daniel Watrous: - It seems that in many cases the design of a model can proceed without addressing the critic and so I chose to change the text "To fix this" to "To address this".  This seems to me more appropriate all of the time. - Fixed various spelling errors. - I began to re-write some of the descriptions to be more readable - A small inconsistency throughout has to do with capitalization of nouns such as class/Class, association/Association, etc.  When referring to model elements we could choose to treat them as proper nouns and capitalize them, otherwise they should all be lower case.  So far I have chosen not to capitalize them.

a9da28d,d00mst@a161b567-7d1e-0410-9ef9-912c70fedb3f,2004-07-20 15:26:24 +0000,Changed registrateTargetListeners to use a more specific cast since java 1.5 has changed EventListenerList.add to a template call. It can be proven that all listeners will be of the specific type: * Listeners are only added to the returned EventListenerList if either   - They are TargetListeners   - They are in a EventListenerList returned from a recursive call to this function * Thus all listeners from the recursive call must be TargetListeners QED

CVS: ---------------------------------------------------------------------- CVS: Issue number: CVS:   If this change addresses one or more issues, CVS:   then enter the issue number(s) here. CVS: Obtained from: CVS:   If this change has been taken from another system, CVS:   then name the system in this line, otherwise delete it. CVS: Submitted by: CVS:   If this code has been contributed to the project by someone else; i.e., CVS:   they sent us a patch or a set of diffs, then include their name/email CVS:   address here. If this is your work then delete this line. CVS: Reviewed by: CVS:   If we are doing pre-commit code reviews and someone else has CVS:   reviewed your changes, include their name(s) here. CVS:   If you have not had it reviewed then delete this line.

3189b1d,dennyd@a161b567-7d1e-0410-9ef9-912c70fedb3f,2001-12-18 18:26:56 +0000,Hello This is a partial src_new.zargo I propose that condense our energies around one document. The src_new.zargo.  This way we'd actually be using Argo and UML to develop Argo itself. The advantages of this are many *complicated refactoring issues could be modeled *test models could be generated and analyzed *limitations of Argo as a UML development environment would quickly become evident to developers *users would be able to benefit from seeing the development process 'in action' as the developers work out tricky pieces of coding *limit the 'repetition' of 'where is what and what does it do?'  questions *document limitations in Argo in a zargo that could be used as reference for UML compliance *model new interfaces or wizards *Use the behavioral and structural diagrams Proposed actions: *Set up a src_new.zargo (this one is not complete) in the CVS *Encourage developers to use the zargo as the starting point for discussion of issues and solutions *Encourage users to use the zargo for reference and for asking questions * link directly in Argo, allowing developers/users, through the help/about,  to download the zargo. This would be  especially nice for tutorials as we know for sure that documentation and notes are successfully saved in zargos now. This would definitely aid in the instruction process for new developers and users alike and bring us all closer to the purpose of UML. To communicate complicated coding issues/solutions in a Unified Modeling Language. Dennis
